amendatorysection.chaptername: Cities Of The Second Class And Villages
amendatorysection.para: When a city or village is thus annexed to another, the property, both real and personal, the notes, bonds, obligations, accounts, demands, evidences of debt, rights, and choses in action, franchises, books, records, maps, plats, and effects of every nature, of and belonging to the two adjacent cities or municipal corporations so annexed, shall be the property of and belong to the corporation to which it is annexed.
